snippet: The news marks a joyous but tense moment in Sierra Leone, where Ebola has crippled the nation’s economy and officials worry the virus could re-emerge at any moment.
abstract: World Health Organization declares Sierra Leone free of Ebola transmissions in public ceremony met with celebration and somber reflection on thousands of lives lost and economic and social setbacks virus left in its wake.

byline.original: By DIONNE SEARCEY and SHERI FINK
byline.contributor: Dionne Searcey reported from Dakar, and Sheri Fink from Ennis, Ireland.

lead_paragraph: The news marks a joyous but tense moment in Sierra Leone, where Ebola has crippled the nation’s economy and officials worry the virus could re-emerge at any moment.

headline.main: Sierra Leone Declared Free of Ebola Transmissions
headline.print_headline: Relief and Caution as W.H.O. Declares Sierra Leone Free of Ebola Transmissions
